description: System-generated primary key uniquely identifying a procedure status record.
Human-readable status code or name used to label a procedure’s state.
Detailed explanation of the procedure status and how it should be used.
Flag indicating whether this status is the default for newly created procedures.
Flag to hide this status from selection lists and dropdowns.
Flag to exclude this status from reports, dashboards, and visualizations.
Flag indicating that applying this status should create a preventive maintenance work order.
Marks the status record as inactive for new use while retaining it for historical reference.
Free-text notes or internal remarks about the status.
System-maintained timestamp of the most recent update to the record.
Timestamp of the last user-initiated change to the record; likely distinct from system updates—confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user who originally created the record.
Timestamp when the record was first created.
Identifier of the user who last updated the record.
Timestamp of the most recent modification recorded by auditing.
